meanings.definition: A unit of electrical potential equal to one million volts.
meanings.sent1: The lightning strike produced a powerful megavolt of electricity.
meanings.sent2: The power plant generated a steady stream of megavolts to supply the city with energy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel got a shock from a tiny megavolt of static electricity.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was like a sudden surge of a megavolt, energizing everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The megavolt of energy in the storm illuminated the night sky with a dazzling display.

meanings.definition: A measurement of electric potential in the metric system, equivalent to one million volts.
meanings.sent1: The scientist recorded the megavolt reading on the device.
meanings.sent2: The power grid was operating at full capacity, reaching several megavolts.
meanings.sent3: The tiny robot marveled at the huge megavolt measurement on the screen.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the room was like a sudden surge of a megavolt, electrifying the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The megavolt measurement on the gauge indicated a massive amount of electrical power.
